page.title: 05Compton Abdale
page.content: Compton Abdale is a pretty cotswold village that sits in a valley. A small clean stream splashes along the side of the village road. At the crossroads in the centre of the village there is a carved stone head of a crocodile with stream water gushing out of its mouth. From the crocodile a steep path leads up to the old church of St.Oswalds. The old post office is now a house called Ye Old Post House. The old mill is now disused and someone is now converting it into a house. There are no young children in Compton Abdale and no school. Most people go shopping in either Cheltenham or Cirencester. The bus goes on Thursday and Saturday to Cheltenham. There is a social club on Thursday nights.
